skill.name: defi-protocol-templates
skill.description: Implement DeFi protocols with production-ready templates for staking, AMMs, governance, and lending systems. Use when building decentralized finance applications or smart contract protocols.
skill.summary: Implement DeFi protocols with production-ready templates for staking, AMMs, governance, and lending ...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, network calls, or external execution logic detected. The content is static Solidity templates and guidance only.

content.value_statement: You need reliable DeFi contract starters but do not want to design from scratch. This skill provides clear staking, AMM, governance, and flash loan templates you can adapt.
actual_capabilities: Provides a staking rewards contract template with accounting logic
Provides a simple AMM contract with liquidity and swap flow
Provides governance token and proposal voting contract templates
Provides a flash loan provider and receiver example
limitations: No tests, deployment scripts, or configuration are included
Templates are not audited for production use
No oracle, liquidation, or lending implementation is provided
Referenced assets and reference files are not present in this package

use_cases.title: Prototype a DeFi MVP
use_cases.description: Adapt the staking and AMM templates to validate a new protocol concept quickly.

use_cases.title: Define protocol scope
use_cases.description: Review governance and flash loan examples to outline requirements and risks.

use_cases.title: Baseline pattern review
use_cases.description: Compare custom contracts against the templates to identify missing controls.

prompt_templates.title: Staking overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize the staking rewards template and list the key state variables and events.

prompt_templates.title: AMM walkthrough
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how addLiquidity, removeLiquidity, and swap work in the AMM template.

prompt_templates.title: Governance lifecycle
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline the proposal lifecycle in the governance template and note where custom logic belongs.

prompt_templates.title: Flash loan review
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify the flash loan checks in the template and suggest two additional safeguards.

output_examples.input: Explain the AMM template and list the main functions.
output: The AMM tracks two token reserves and issues liquidity shares.
Main functions are addLiquidity, removeLiquidity, and swap.
Pricing uses a constant product model with a 0.3 percent fee.

best_practices: Add comprehensive unit tests before deployment
Use audited libraries for token and access control logic
Review math for rounding and overflow assumptions
anti_patterns: Deploying templates without a security review
Skipping access control or pause mechanisms
Ignoring token decimal and fee edge cases

faq.question: What platforms are compatible?
faq.answer: The templates target EVM chains that support Solidity and OpenZeppelin libraries.

faq.question: What are the limits of the templates?
faq.answer: They are minimal examples and do not include oracle, liquidation, or upgrade logic.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my project?
faq.answer: Copy the relevant template and adapt interfaces, parameters, and access control.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data?
faq.answer: No. It contains static templates and guidance with no data collection code.

faq.question: What if compilation fails?
faq.answer: Verify Solidity version and OpenZeppelin dependency compatibility.

faq.question: How does this compare to full protocol frameworks?
faq.answer: It is lighter for prototyping but lacks complete production features.
